changes: Initial release
Changed the fountain around a bit
Much more responsive to the music
Added 6 different fountain modes
Added a menu feature accessible by typing ‘?’ or ‘h’
The particle size is controllable by ‘+’ and ‘-’
Other minor improvements and bug fixes
Added control over the modes
Speed improved
Both audio channels are used
Fixed a bug which prevented some from using it
Fixed a bug which caused iTunes to crash when the user rated a song
Added control over the particle edge sharpness (< and > keys)
Added FPS and particle counters (f and p keys, respectively)
Added an advanced menu (‘~’ key)
Now remembers settings between uses
Many internal improvements and some minor graphical bugs fixed
Two new modes, Starfish and Flower, bringing the total to 8
Speed improvements
Four months worth of minor tweaks
Full resolution in full screen, ‘r’ key rotates resolutions
Version display (k key)
Controllable gravity
Settings dialog, controls gravity, particle size, edges, etc.
Save preferences between relaunches of iTunes
Continuous FPS calculation
Smoother motion at low frame rates
Option to always show track info
Some graphical tweaks
Antialiased text
Multiple color schemes
Easy installer and uninstaller
Gravity control range expanded
Minor speed and graphical improvements, as always
Universal binary
Full unicode support for track names
Control over text size for track info
Overall stability improvements
Released as free software under the GPL
Fixed “glitchy/broken window” bug
Slightly refined particle appearance
Requires iTunes 10 and Mac OS X Snow Leopard
Fixes reduced frame-rate issue while playing music
Overall smoother animation
Refined appearance of on-screen text
Consumes fewer resources when not activated
Removes support for selecting full screen resolution
New, simpler install process
Source re-released under a BSD-style license
